intro: Eriopsis, commonly known as the "devil's toenail," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow or white flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. The plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. Eriopsis species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. They are sometimes considered weeds in agricultural areas due to their rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed soils.
